column17: Salwar kameez is a traditional dress worn by both women and men in South Asia. Shalwar or salwar are loose pajama-like trousers. The legs are wide at the top and narrow at the ankle. The kameez is a long shirt or tunic. The side seams left open below the waist-line give the wearer greater freedom of movement. The third piece Dupatta is worn like a scarf on the shoulders & chest on top of Kameez. Our salwar kameez are unstitched - with 2.25m of Kameez fabric 2.25m of Salwar & 2.25m of Dupatta fabric.
